title: How to Make Squirrel Salad

steps.headline: Clean the mushrooms, slice them and cover in lemon juice.
Break up the hazelnuts into large pieces.
Arrange the salad elements for serving.
Serve.
steps.description: It should be accompanied by good quality French bread, in particular baguette slices. Delicious!

text:
Wash the baby spinach leaves. Remove any stems. Scrape the Parmesan into shavings. Clean the mushrooms, slice them and cover in lemon juice. Break up the hazelnuts into large pieces. Arrange the salad elements for serving. Take 4 - 6 salad plates and arrange the salad as follows: Place the baby spinach leaves on each plate{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b2/Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b2/Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Add the sliced mushrooms{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/11/Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/11/Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Season with salt and pepper{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Drizzle the two oils over the salad and mix{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet4.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet4.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Finish by tossing on the Parmesan shavings, the broken hazelnuts and chive pieces (cut the pieces using kitchen scissors). {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/30/Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet5.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/30/Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet5.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Squirrel-Salad-Step-5Bullet5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Serve. It should be accompanied by good quality French bread, in particular baguette slices. Delicious! Finished.
